messageBody:
That sounds like a very good idea. That would get around the concerns I
have of running to DB tests too many times on a live DB for fear of
running out of primary (a pretty daft fear I might add).

This technique, however, is dependant on your locking model. If you ran
on a database that used optimistic locking (Oracle) you could find that
everything worked ok. But if you had committed then problems would have
occurred. I guess this would be pretty rare and only occur when
multiple updates are occurring at the same time. That is stress testing
and not the job of Junit. It's worth being aware of the limitations
though.

Dave
